author: Harper Lee
review: A powerful story of racial injustice and moral growth set in the American South during the Great Depression.

author: George Orwell
review: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian regime, exploring themes of surveillance, propaganda, and individual freedom.

author: Jane Austen
review: A classic romantic novel following the lives of the Bennet sisters and their pursuit of love and happiness in early 19th-century England.

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
review: An exploration of the American Dream through the eyes of the mysterious Jay Gatsby, set in the Jazz Age of the 1920s.

bookName: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
review: The first book in the beloved Harry Potter series, following the young wizard's journey as he discovers his magical heritage and battles the dark wizard Voldemort.

author: J.D. Salinger
review: A coming-of-age novel following Holden Caulfield, a disenchanted teenager navigating the complexities of adolescence and society.
